sys_hub_flow.description:
This flow sends a DocuSign envelope to a user using a template. Use case: Send a job offer to a candiate. This flow reads the DocuSign envelope values from catalog variables, enables a second ServiceNow user to review and make changes to catalog variable values, allows the recipient to make changes to envelope fields and finally reads the recipient data and updates back in ServiceNow record.

Trigger:

  • Service Catalog: When a new request item is created with the respective catalog item.

Flow Steps:

  1. Get catalog variables from the respective request item.
  2. Create a draft DocuSign Envelope using the provided template.
  3. Get Recipient ID based on the role name in the template.
  4. Get Document ID based on the document name in the template.
  5. Sub-Flow: To populate the draft envelope with the catalog variable values.
  6. Get field ID for those fields used in the template with same tab label, to ascertain their respective tab IDs.
  7. Set field values for those fields used in the template with same tab label.
  8. Assign the request item to 'Hiring Manager' user for review and approval.
  9. Sub-Flow: To populate the draft envelope with updated catalog variable values, if any.
  10. Get the candidate email field value.
  11. Adds the recipient to the draft envelope.
  12. Sends the envelope to the recipient.
  13. Once the envelope is acted on by the recipient, attaches the envelope document to the request item.
  14. If the envelope status is completed, read the variable value updated by the candidate and update back to the catalog variable.

Additional Notes:

  • This flow is only intended to work with one specific pre-defined DocuSign template.
  • The envelope tab labels in the DocuSign Template should match exactly with the catalog questions.
  • User must have connection and credential aliases created under DocuSign Spoke.
  • Requires a subscription to a DocuSign API Plan that satisfies your feature and transactions requirements. Read More.

Note: Requires a subscription for production use. Read More.
